page.title: 10PLACE NAMES
page.content: GLASSHOUSES - was so-called as the glass used at Fountains Abbey was made here,using silica sand from Smelthouses. HEYSHAW - means "an enclosed copse". BEWERLEY - means "a beaver glade". DACRE - means "a trickling stream". WILSILL - was mentioned in the Domesday Book under its original name of "WIFELSHAELH", which means Wifel's Nook. LOW LAITHE - means the low barn of Braisty Farm. MAJUBA - a field at Braisty Woods was called this because they were cutting big millstones in the nearby wood at the time of the Battle of Majuba in the Boer War.
